Hosea or Osee__10.1: Israel a vine full of branches, the fruit is agreeable to it: according to the multitude of his fruit he hath multiplied altars, according to the plenty of his land he hath abounded with idols.
Hosea or Osee__10.2: Their heart is divided: now they shall perish: he shall break down their idols, he shall destroy their altars.
Hosea or Osee__10.3: For now they shall say: We have no king: because we fear not the Lord: and what shall a king do to us?
Hosea or Osee__10.4: You speak words of an unprofitable vision, and you shall make a covenant: and judgment shall spring up as bitterness in the furrows of the field.
Hosea or Osee__10.5: The inhabitants of Samaria have worshipped <u>the kine of Bethaven</u>: for the people thereof have mourned over it, and the wardens of its temple that rejoiced over it in its glory because it is departed from it.
Hosea or Osee__10.6: For <u>itself also is carried</u> into Assyria, a present to the avenging king: shame shall fall upon Ephraim, and Israel shall be confounded in his own will.
Hosea or Osee__10.7: Samaria hath made her king to pass as froth upon the face of the water.
Hosea or Osee__10.8: And the high places of the idol, the sin of Israel shall be destroyed: the bur and the thistle shall grow up over their altars: and they shall say to the mountains: Cover us; and to the hills: Fall upon us.
Hosea or Osee__10.9: From the days of Gabaa, Israel hath sinned, there they stood: the battle in Gabaa against the children of iniquity shall not overtake them.
Hosea or Osee__10.10: According to my desire I will chastise them: and the nations shall be gathered together against them, when they shall be chastised for <u>their two iniquities</u>.
Hosea or Osee__10.11: Ephraim is a heifer taught to love to tread out corn, but I passed over upon the beauty of her neck: I will ride upon Ephraim, Juda shall plough, Jacob shall break the furrows for himself.
Hosea or Osee__10.12: Sow for yourselves in justice, and reap in the mouth of mercy, break up your fallow ground: but the time to seek the Lord is, when he shall come that shall teach you justice.
Hosea or Osee__10.13: You have ploughed wickedness, you have reaped iniquity, you have eaten the fruit of lying: because thou hast trusted in thy ways, in the multitude of thy strong ones.
Hosea or Osee__10.14: A tumult shall arise among thy people: and all thy fortresses shall be destroyed <u>as Salmana was destroyed, by the house</u> of him that judged Baal in the day of battle, the mother being dashed in pieces upon her children.
Hosea or Osee__10.15: So hath Bethel done to you, because of the evil of your iniquities.
